definitions: idea, behavior, or style that spreads rapidly through culture via imitation
examples: The dancing baby became an early internet meme
That catchphrase turned into a popular meme overnight

definitions: physical item kept as a reminder of a person or event
examples: She kept the concert ticket as a memento
The old photograph serves as a precious memento

definitions: short informal business document for internal communication
examples: The manager sent a memo about the policy change
Please read the memo regarding office hours

definitions: written account of personal experiences and memories from one's life
examples: The actress published a memoir about her career
His wartime memoir became a bestselling book

definitions: objects collected because of their historical interest or personal associations
examples: The museum displays sports memorabilia from famous athletes
She collects movie memorabilia from classic films

definitions: multiple formal written messages or notes used in business communication
examples: The secretary filed all the memoranda from last month
Several memoranda were distributed before the meeting

definitions: official document recording terms of agreement or outlining policy matters
examples: The memorandum outlined the new company procedures
Both parties signed the memorandum of understanding

definitions: process of learning something thoroughly to remember it exactly
examples: Memorization of vocabulary helps with language learning
The actor spent weeks on memorization of lines

definitions: person or thing that causes harm or poses a threat
examples: The aggressive dog was a menace to the neighborhood
Drunk drivers are a menace on the roads

definitions: diverse collection of wild or exotic animals kept for exhibition
examples: The circus featured a traveling menagerie of animals
Her backyard has become a menagerie of rescued pets

definitions: place where something torn or broken has been fixed
examples: The mend in the fabric was barely visible
You can see the mend where the vase was glued

definitions: act of fixing damaged clothing or fabric items
examples: She spent the afternoon doing mending for the family
The basket held clothes waiting for mending

definitions: person who performs unskilled or degrading work for others
examples: The wealthy estate employed several menials for housework
He started as a menial in the kitchen

definitions: permanent cessation of menstruation marking the end of a woman's reproductive years
examples: She experienced hot flashes during menopause
Menopause typically occurs between ages 45 and 55

definitions: ceremonial candelabrum with seven or nine branches used in Jewish worship
examples: They lit the menorah during the Hanukkah celebration
The temple displayed a beautiful golden menorah

definitions: person of honor and integrity who acts with wisdom and kindness
examples: Everyone considers him a real mensch for helping
She proved herself a mensch by keeping her promise

definitions: regular discharge of blood and tissue from the uterus in reproductive-age females
examples: She tracks her menstruation cycle with an app
Menstruation typically lasts three to seven days

definitions: particular way of thinking that characterizes a person or group
examples: The team developed a winning mentality this season
His negative mentality affects his work performance

definitions: organic compound from mint oils producing a cooling sensation
examples: The cough drops contain menthol for throat relief
Menthol cigarettes have a minty flavor

definitions: characteristic crying sound made by a domestic cat
examples: The hungry cat's meow woke everyone up
She heard a soft meow coming from the bushes

definitions: economic theory promoting government regulation of trade to increase national wealth through favorable balance
examples: European nations practiced mercantilism during the colonial period
Mercantilism encouraged the accumulation of gold and silver

definitions: professional soldier who fights for any country or group that pays
examples: The mercenary fought for the highest bidder
Private military companies employ modern mercenaries

definitions: commercial goods bought and sold in business transactions
examples: The store displays its merchandise in window displays
Online retailers ship merchandise directly to customers

definitions: practice of promoting goods for retail sale through display and marketing
examples: Effective merchandising increases product sales significantly
The company invested heavily in visual merchandising

definitions: commercial vessel designed for transporting goods rather than passengers
examples: The merchantman carried spices from the East Indies
Pirates often targeted wealthy merchantman vessels

definitions: heavy silvery metallic element that is liquid at room temperature
Roman god of commerce, communication, and travelers
examples: Mercury thermometers contain the toxic liquid metal
The old barometer uses mercury to measure pressure
Mercury was known for his winged sandals
Ancient Romans built temples to honor Mercury

definitions: combining of two or more companies into a single entity
examples: The merger created the largest bank in the region
Shareholders voted to approve the corporate merger

definitions: act of joining or blending two or more things together
examples: The merging of traffic requires careful attention
Data merging combines information from multiple sources

definitions: imaginary line running from pole to pole on Earth's surface
highest point of development or achievement
examples: Greenwich serves as the prime meridian for navigation
Ships calculate position using meridian lines
He reached the meridian of his career at fifty
The empire was at its meridian of power

definitions: light sweet dessert made from whipped egg whites and sugar
examples: The lemon meringue pie has a fluffy topping
She piped meringue kisses onto the baking sheet

definitions: breed of sheep valued for producing very fine soft wool
examples: Merino wool makes the softest sweaters
Australia raises millions of merino sheep

definitions: social system where advancement depends on individual ability and achievement rather than class
examples: The company promotes a meritocracy for career advancement
Universities ideally function as intellectual meritocracies

definitions: small fierce falcon found across northern regions hunting small birds
examples: The merlin swooped down to catch its prey
Birdwatchers spotted a merlin near the coastline

definitions: legendary aquatic creature with a woman's upper body and fish tail
examples: The sailor claimed he saw a mermaid at sea
Children love stories about mermaids and underwater kingdoms

definitions: mythical male creature with human upper body and fish tail
examples: The merman ruled the underwater palace
Folklore describes merman warriors protecting the seas

definitions: elevated landform with steep sides and a flat top found in arid regions
examples: The mesa rose dramatically from the desert floor
Native American pueblos were built atop mesas

definitions: hallucinogenic alkaloid found in peyote cactus causing altered perception and consciousness
examples: Mescaline has been used in religious ceremonies for centuries
The effects of mescaline can last twelve hours

definitions: material made of connected strands forming regular open spaces
examples: The window screen uses fine mesh to keep bugs out
Safety mesh prevents items from falling through

definitions: rare aggressive cancer affecting the lining of lungs usually caused by asbestos exposure
examples: Workers exposed to asbestos risk developing mesothelioma
The diagnosis of mesothelioma came decades after exposure

definitions: thorny tree or shrub native to dry regions producing edible pods
examples: Mesquite wood gives barbecue a distinctive smoky flavor
Desert animals feed on mesquite pods

definitions: system or process of sending and receiving electronic messages between devices
examples: Instant messaging allows real-time conversation online
The company uses secure messaging for sensitive communications

definitions: person who carries messages or documents between people or places
examples: The messenger delivered the urgent letter by noon
Bike messengers navigate city traffic quickly

definitions: promised deliverer of Jewish nation prophesied in Hebrew scripture
leader regarded as a savior of a people or cause
examples: Christians believe Jesus is the Messiah
Jewish faith awaits the coming of the Messiah
The fans see him as a messiah for the team
People hoped for a political messiah to solve problems

definitions: person of mixed European and indigenous American ancestry especially in Latin America
examples: Many mestizo communities maintain both cultural traditions
The mestizo population forms the majority in several countries

definitions: chemical processes in living organisms that convert food into energy and building materials
examples: Regular exercise can boost your metabolism
His fast metabolism allows him to eat without gaining weight

definitions: substance or material containing or resembling metal in properties
examples: The paint has a shiny metallic finish
She tasted something metallic in the water
